initial_step.instruction: Confirm that you are working ONLY with the final target image provided for analysis. Disregard all previous example images.

pass_1_identification.step: Scan ONLY within the target image for potential LaTeX formula structures.
If no potential formulas are found, immediately skip to the final_verification step.
Mark all potential LaTeX formula areas in the target image and save it in your mind.
Confirm that you have not considered any example images in this process.

latex_criteria.criterion: Uses mathematical symbols or Greek letters
Structured with proper LaTeX syntax (e.g., proper use of {}, ^, _)
Represents a complete mathematical expression or equation

context_check.step: Analyze text immediately before and after the potential LaTeX formula in the target image, to help you. Don't return that text, just keep it in your mind.
Check for equation numbers or labels associated with the formula in the target image.
Reject if part of a larger text section without clear mathematical content.

additional_checks.step: For each potential formula, explicitly confirm it exists in the target image, not in any example.
If you realize a formula is from an example, immediately discard it.

full_latex_capture.step: If a LaTeX formula is verified in the target image, capture all related LaTeX code within the formula element according to the format provided.
If no formulas were found or verified, prepare to report that no formulas were detected.

final_verification.step: Review each captured formula and confirm its presence in the target image.
If any doubt exists about a formula's source, discard it.
Confirm one last time that you have only analyzed the target image and have not included any information from the example images.
